get.description: Retrieves all profiles

post.description: Creates a new profile (JSON only)

Creates a single profile for guardian (mother or father) with baby details. The profile type will be 'mother' or 'father' based on the guardian type. Baby details (name, DOB, gender, image) are stored in the profile along with guardian consent for communication. Milestone and vaccine schedules are automatically generated for the baby based on DOB. Accepts multipart/form-data with optional baby image file. The 'request' field should contain a JSON string with guardian and baby details.
Creates a baby profile for users who have already registered offline. Valid codes: APOLLO2024, FORTIS2024, MAX2024. Optionally link to guardian via guardianProfileId.
Links a baby profile to a mother profile by setting guardianProfileId

Ask questions about your newborn's health. Supports session-based conversation history. Provide sessionId to maintain conversation context across multiple messages. The system uses a pediatric-aware AI assistant with built-in safety guidelines. Accepts babyProfileId and userMessage - internally retrieves baby profile, vaccines, and milestones data.
Creates a new document in MongoDB

get.description: Retrieves all milestones ordered by age

post.description: Creates a new milestone
Seeds milestones from MILESTONE_SEED_DATA.json

post.summary: Mark milestone as achieved by scheduleId
post.description: Marks a milestone schedule item as achieved with optional image proof using scheduleId. Automatically generates and returns a badge if the milestone qualifies for one based on achievement timing (early/normal/late). Badges are only generated if the milestone has badge information configured in the seed data.
Generates milestone schedule for a baby based on their date of birth
Updates milestone schedule statuses based on expected dates

post.summary: Mark milestone as achieved by babyId and milestoneItemId
post.description: Marks a milestone schedule item as achieved using baby profileId and milestoneItemId (e.g., 'wk1_recognises_your_voice'). This is a convenience endpoint that finds the schedule automatically. Automatically generates and returns a badge if the milestone qualifies for one based on achievement timing (early/normal/late). Badges are only generated if the milestone has badge information configured in the seed data.

post.summary: Mark milestone as achieved by babyId and id (UUID)
post.description: Marks a milestone schedule item as achieved using baby profileId and the schedule's unique MongoDB id (UUID). This endpoint validates that the schedule belongs to the specified baby before marking as achieved. Automatically generates and returns a badge if the milestone qualifies for one based on achievement timing (early/normal/late). Badges are only generated if the milestone has badge information configured in the seed data.

get.summary: Get milestone progress for baby profile
get.description:
Retrieves milestone progress for a baby profile, grouped into 'Now', 'Soon', and 'Done' categories. Milestones are calculated based on baby DOB and milestone seed data (week-based). 

**cutoffDate Parameter (Optional):**
If provided, filters milestones to only show those that are relevant up to the specified date. This is useful for:
- Viewing milestone progress as of a past date (e.g., 'What milestones were due last month?')
- Planning ahead by setting a future cutoff date
- Filtering out future milestones that aren't relevant yet

**How it works:**
- For 'Now' and 'Soon' categories: Only includes milestones with expected date/week <= cutoffDate
- For 'Done' category: Only includes milestones achieved on or before cutoffDate
- If not provided, returns all milestones based on current date

**Example:** If cutoffDate is '2025-12-15', you'll only see milestones that were expected or achieved by December 15th, 2025.

parameters.name: cutoffDate
parameters.description: Optional cutoff date (ISO format: YYYY-MM-DD). Filters milestones to only include those expected or achieved up to this date. If not provided, uses current date.
